org.mokai
Class Message

java.lang.Object
  org.mokai.Message
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Message
extends Object
implements Serializable

Represents a message that is being routing through the gateway.

Author:
German Escobar
See Also:
Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
static class Message.Direction
          Tells whether the message is outbound (from applications to connections) or inbound (from connections to applications)

getProperties

public final Map<String,Object> getProperties()
Returns the user properties (i.e. it excludes the Mokai properties, those that start with MK_).

Returns:
a map of string-object tuples.

getProperty

Returns the value of a property as an object.

Returns:
the value of the property if it exists or null otherwise.

getProperty

public final <T> T getProperty(String key,
                               Class<T> clazz)
Returns the value of a property when the type is known.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the property.
Parameters:
key - the key of the property whose value we are searching.
clazz - the class of the property
Returns:
the value of the property if it exists or null otherwise.

setProperty

public final Message setProperty(String key,
                                 Object value)
Sets a property in the map. If the property exists, it will be modified.

Parameters:
key - the key of the property to be added or modified.
value - the value of the property to be added or modified.
Returns:
the Message instance for chaining.

removeProperty

public final void removeProperty(String key)
Removes a property from the map if it exists. Notice that is possible to remove Mokai properties, although not recommended.

Parameters:
key - the key of the property to be removed.
